title: WATCH: NYC Mayor Warns Trump Supporters to 'Control Themselves,' Claims City Respects Law And Order
description:
Unless you have been living underneath a rock, you are likely aware that Donald Trump was indicted last week. On what charges? We don't know. Something about paying off porn star Stormy Daniels. But it's unclear what, if anything, is illegal about that, and the indictment is currently sealed.

Trump arrived in New York City today ahead of his arraignment, which prompted Mayor Eric Adams to hold a briefing on security preparations for the city. Specifically, he warned Trump supporters to "control" themselves.

"There may be some rabble rousers thinking about coming to our city tomorrow...Our message is clear and simple: control yourselves."

"NYC is our home, not a playground for your misplaced anger...although we have no specific threats, people like Marjorie Taylor Greene, who is known to spread misinformation and hate speech, stated she is coming to town."

\u201cEric Adams tells Trump supporters to "control yourselves"\n\n"NYC is our home, not a playground for your misplaced anger...although we have no specific threats, people like Marjorie Taylor Greene, who is known to spread misinformation and hate speech, stated she is coming to town."\u201d
— Washington Free Beacon (@Washington Free Beacon) 1680538428

He also claimed that New York City respects the rule of law and does not allow any sort of vandalism or violence. Which is weird, because I feel like I remember something a few years ago where the city was overrun with violence and arson for months. And from what I've heard of New York City nowadays, it's still not exactly a safe haven. Particularly not the subway.

And I can't help but wonder how Adams would have reacted differently if, say, Joe Biden were indicted and people wanted to protest. The most recent comparable event that sparked protests was the death of Tyre Nichols, which prompted Adams to call for peaceful protests: "I think the Memphis police chief responded swiftly, and I believe New Yorkers have the right to peacefully voice their concern if the video is what we anticipate it will be. This police department is the best at responding to any form of protests." Which sounds a whole lot different than "control yourselves".

title: That Story About A Florida Principal Getting Canned For A Lesson On Renaissance Art? It Wasn't True. At All.
description:
Over the past week or so, mainstream media has been going wild with a report that a Florida school principal was fired for teaching a lesson on Michelangelo's David statue. But as it turns out, it wasn't true. Shocking.

Media claimed parents deemed the lesson about the statue to be pornographic. This was clearly meant to hit back at Governor DeSantis's policies that ban porn in schools. Since Michelaneglo's work clearly isn't porn, the media tried to frame the story as if DeSantis's policies and conservative parents are ridiculously Puritan and actually limiting children's education.

But they're not, of course. DeSantis and conservatives literally just want to ban porn in library books. Because there was literally porn in library books. And that's something most parents would call a "problem."

Plus, the principal in question wasn't even fired for this lesson. Mark Hemingway of RealClearInvestigations sleuthed this out by reading past the headline of CNN's article, in which they admitted the principal wasn't fired for the lesson.

The article quoted the school board chair as saying, "She was not let go because of Michelangelo's David lesson."

Oh.

\u201cBang-up job CNN \u2014 your own story contradicts your deliberately misleading headline designed to further a political narrative.\u201d
— Mark Hemingway (@Mark Hemingway) 1679835724

It goes on to explain:

"'Our school is two and a half years old. Every year we show that picture in the Renaissance Art class taught to our sixth graders,' [the school board chair] added. The problem that arose in this instance was that the procedure for notifying parents of the upcoming lesson was not followed."

"'We aren't trying to ban the picture,' he said, referring to the statue of David. 'We think it's beautiful, but we are going to make sure the concept of parental rights is supreme in Florida and at our charter school.'"

And 97% of the parents were fine with the lesson. So no, Florida schools do not consider beautiful pieces of Renaissance artwork to be pornographic. They consider pornographic library books to be pornographic. And they just want to make sure parents are aware of what their children are being taught.

The audacity.

title: WATCH: 60 Minutes Australia Interviews American Mother Of Gender-Neutral 'Theybie' And It's Terrifying
description:
60 Minutes Australia did a whole segment on an American mother who decided to raise her child as a "theybie". Meaning, the mother pretended the doctor who delivered her child actually didn't have the ability to tell whether it was a boy or a girl. Only the child knows that, since it has nothing to do with biology. Apparently.

The mother insisted, "We're not trying to eliminate gender, we're trying to show how limitless gender can be." Which doesn't make any sense, because if you remove all boundaries and defining terms from something, then said thing ceases to exist. But I gave up trying to understand their math long ago.

\u201cParents are deliberately keeping the sex of their babies top secret because they say the children themselves should be free to decide who they are. That means the little ones are being raised not as baby boys or baby girls, but as \u2018theybies\u2019.\n\nWatch #60Mins on @9Now\u201d
— 60 Minutes Australia (@60 Minutes Australia) 1680433253

The narrator explains, "Seven years ago, Kyl and her Australian husband Brent had their first baby, Zoomer."

Yes, the child's name is Zoomer. And yet that's the least horrible part of the story.

The mother says she didn't disclose Zoomer's "reproductive anatomy" to anyone who didn't need to know. The camera then cuts to a shot of her reading Zoomer a book about how gender is not based on biology, but what you feel inside. Various shots show the child with long hair wearing dresses, and at other times with short hair and dressed more masculine.

Oh, and Kyl, the mother, wrote a whole book about her experience called "Raising Them". But don't worry, no financial motive here. Not even a tiny one.

The craziest part comes at the end of the clip, when the Australian interviewer pushes back ever-so-slightly on Kyle's lunacy. She clarified that Kyle believes that if a child is born with a penis, it doesn't actually make them a boy. Kyle agreed. Then the interviewer asked whether this could be confusing for a little child. (Yes. Yes it could.)

But Kyle answered, with a heart-stopping smile on her face, "I think it's actually more confusing to make children think that the eight billion people on the planet neatly fit into one or two boxes."

Nope. Not more confusing. That's actually just the biological and Biblical truth of humanity. And kids wouldn't even question it if adults didn't give them a reason to. So why are adults giving them reason to?

>

<

title: American Idol contestant who was mom-shamed by Katy Perry has quit the show
description:
Sarah Beth Liebe, the American Idol contestant who got both mom and slut shamed by Katy Perry, has quit the show. She decided it was more important to her to be a mother.

Fox News reports after her next audition singing The Police's "Roxanne," Liebee decided the reality show star life wasn't for her. "This opportunity is really rad, but this is actually going to be my last performance because my heart’s at home. So, I’m going to get home to my babies. They kind of need me."

Leibe confirmed quitting on Instagram. The judges tried to get her to stay, with Perry telling the mother she had originally shamed "self-love is just as big as motherly love."

To recap how we got here:

Sarah Beth Liebe is twenty-five and a mother of three. Upon declaring that information during her audition, Perry got up and walked away. The concept of having three kids was that shocking to her. When Liebe said "If Katy lays on the table I think I'm going to pass out," Perry responded, "Honey, you've been laying on the table too much."

Sara Beth Is A Mother Of Three And An Accidental American Idol - American Idol 2023 youtu.be

What Perry was saying is that Sara Beth likes to f*ck. Since, you know, making sex is how babies are made. And having three kids means Sara Beth had sex *counts on fingers* at least three times.

Something I'm sure Katy Perry knows nothing about.

Sara Beth made it through to Hollywood. I'm not sure how you can say your voice can't handle singing Elton John so you attempt Amy Winehouse. But both Benny and The Jets got her through to the next round.

But seeing Amy's dismissive, mom-shaming comments hit different when Sara Beth saw them back on television. "It was embarrassing to have that on TV. It was hurtful. I think that women supporting and uplifting other women is so cool and I think that mom-shaming is super lame. I think that it's hard enough to be a mom and it's hard enough to be a woman."

@sarabethliebe Well. I didnt think id be making this video, but i just wanted to say a couple things since im being flooded with articles and comments/messages about this.
♬ original sound - Sara Beth

Sara Beth went on to give a shout-out to all the moms out there because no one deserves to feel crappy about being a good mama.

Two things. One, shout out to the GOAT Lionel Richie because we see him there. Ten bucks say when at least one of those babies was made, it was with "Endless Love" and not "Teenage Dream."

It's Sunday morning. And you know what that means. pic.twitter.com/q6hsuDm6Bx
— Louder with Crowder Dot Com (@LWCnewswire) April 2, 2023

Two, I thought everyone was being a little too overdramatic (including everyone on the internet) which I'm sure the producers of American Idol love. But I sympathize with Sara Beth. When you are auditioning, there is a lot going on and the only thing that registers are the words 'you made it through to Hollywood." Watching back at home, Katy Perry joked that Sara Beth was a slut.

Why? Because Sara Beth has three kids. That is Katy Perry's definition of having too much sex. That is KATY PERRY'S definition of having too much sex.

I'm not sure when any of this airs. Or, if any of this has aired yet. I fell off after the David Cook season and would be lying if I thought the show was still on television prior to this incident.

title: McDonald's Shuts All U.S. Offices Ahead of Layoffs, And They Might Just Change Their Menu, Too.
description:
It's a sad day in America, my friends. McDonald's has shut all of its offices based in the United States in anticipation of layoffs.

International employees were told via email to work from home until this Wednesday so layoff notices can be delivered virtually. They also asked all employees to cancel all in-person meetings with vendors at its headquarters.

\u201cMcDonald's Corp\u00a0is temporarily closing its U.S. offices this week as it prepares to inform corporate employees about its layoffs as part of a broader company restructuring, the Wall Street Journal\u00a0reported\u00a0on Sunday\n#McDonalds \nhttps://t.co/5Ojafaj6gg\u201d
— The Telegraph (@The Telegraph) 1680487949

It's unclear how many employees will be laid off. Chief Executive Chris Kempczinski previously said the move would save money, but didn't elaborate on how much they hope to save. So we can probably chalk it up to Sleepy Joe's economy.

Unfortunately, there's more bad news. The McDonald's menu might change, too. An email from January that warned of the coming layoffs also suggested menus could be simplified with less duplication. AKA variety.

The CEO wrote, "We had across the globe 70 different, distinct versions of what a crispy chicken sandwich would look like. I don't need 70 different permutations of a chicken sandwich." The sass is palpable.

I've always thought Mickey D's variety across the globe was one of the most, if not the only, interesting things about the chain. YouTube is full of videos of people trying foreign McDonald's menus. Like the McArabia Chicken in the United Arab Emirates, which is a sandwich of grilled chicken and garlic sauce between Arabic bread. Or in Japan, the Bai Teriyaki Chicken Fillet-O or the McSpicy Shanghai Burger. Spain has a McCrispy Honey Mustard, and Britain has a Mayo Chicken. Which sounds pretty boring to me. But I'll let the Brits be with their mayonnaise.

\u201cWill McDonald's US shake up affect menus around the world? Fears for fast food as giant prepares to layoff staff https://t.co/gx5Chx4Uko\u201d
— Daily Mail Online (@Daily Mail Online) 1680526619

I'm no business man, but I would think cutting the global variety of foods would just make fans unhappy. But perhaps so many people eat at McDonald's anyway, they can afford to make some menu cuts. As long as they don't take the McFlurries. Those concoctions of corn syrup and heavy cream take me straight back to childhood.

>

title: Watch: Marjorie Taylor Greene leaves 60 minutes host speechless over alleged pedophilia in Democratic Party
description:
Marjorie Taylor Greene's 60 Minutes appearance was certainly one for the books. She defended calling the entire Democratic Party "pedophiles". Host Lesley Stahl seemed quite shocked, to say the least.

Stahl repeated MTG's claim to her that the Democratic Party is full of pedos, and waited for her response. But instead of couching her words or going on the defense, Greene simply said, "I would definitely say so. They support grooming children."

Of course Stahl denied this, totally incredulous at the idea. But Greene elaborated, "Even Joe Biden, the president himself, supports children being sexualized and having transgender surgeries. Sexualizing children is what pedophiles do to children."

Stahl's only response was "wow," along with a sassy little eye roll.

\u201cMTG calls out grooming and leaves Lesley Stahl literally speechless\u201d
— End Wokeness (@End Wokeness) 1680477955

So that was pretty bold of our gal MTG. But it wasn't the only bold moment of the interview. MTG also said we should stop funding a proxy war in Ukraine and push for peace instead.

Stahl asked the totally-not-leading question, "You're opposed to giving Ukraine weapons and aid to help Ukraine fight off the Russians. It strikes me that that's what Putin wants."

MTG fired back, "I don't really care what Putin wants [...] What I have voted against is funding a war in Ukraine. The entire time I have been saying the United States needs to be pushing for peace in Ukraine. Not funding a proxy war with Russia."

Stahl pushed back with various arguments, like "Putin will invade Poland!" and "What about China?" But MTG held firm, simply explaining, "I'm sorry, but Ukraine is not the 51st state." Which many of our political leaders seem to have forgotten.

\u201cMarjorie Taylor Greene on 60 minutes: "The United States needs to be pushing for peace in Ukraine, not funding a proxy war with Russia." @RepMTG\u201d
— 3sidedstory \ud83c\uddfa\ud83c\uddf2 (@3sidedstory \ud83c\uddfa\ud83c\uddf2) 1680481328

Love her or hate her, MTG is certainly a firecracker. And it's very refreshing to see a Republican politician stand firm in their beliefs and not try to please everyone in the room.

title: Elon Musk strips New York Times of its blue checkmark, rubs their face in it just because he can
description:
Elon Musk's most "controversial" Twitter decision was charging people $8 for verification. Entities who got their blue checkmark the old-fashioned way -- bribing Twitter and/or having the same worldview as the people who worked for Twitter -- couldn't stand the thought to be aligned with those of us who felt the eight bucks was worth it for the edit feature. The New York Times declared they will NOT pay the money.

So Elon said "YEET!"

I think Elon was motivated by the New York Times being sanctimonious about it, declaring "The New York Times, which has nearly 55 million followers on Twitter, said on Thursday that it would not pay for the verified badge for its institutional accounts, including @nytimes. The Times also told its journalists that it would not reimburse them for a Twitter Blue subscription, except in rare cases when it was necessary for reporting."

Musk said the real tragedy is when it comes to NYT's propaganda. It's not that interesting.

The real tragedy of @NYTimes is that their propaganda isn’t even interesting
— Elon Musk (@elonmusk) April 2, 2023

I guess Elon doesn't feel The Times caping for pedophiles is all that interesting. Though his issue could be their Elon-specific hit pieces. Like when they called him a global chaos agent. Or was so desperate to stop him from buying Twitter, they attempted to tie him to apartheid.

The Head Twit In Charge also finds NYT's new anti-paying for subscriptions stance to be curious. It's not the propaganda as much as it is the hypocrisy.

NY Times is being incredible hypocritical here, as they are super aggressive about forcing everyone to pay *their* subscription
— Elon Musk (@elonmusk) April 2, 2023

The Times would pay $1000 as an organization and then $50 a month for every verified employee. It's more than the $7 a month. But they could easily redistribute $1 per Times subscriber to cover it.

At the end of the day, I hope Elon and the New York Times can work it out. Without their blue checkmark, we have no idea if a tweet from the Times is their usual bullshit, or someone satirizing their usual bullshit.

title: Watch: No one has said "April Fool's" yet, so Dylan Mulvaney is Bud Light's new spokes...whatever
description:
We didn't hit this over the weekend because this HAD to be an April Fool's prank. There is no way Bud Light could so misunderstand its audience or be so desperate for an ESG boost that they thought this was a good idea. Yet here we are the morning of April 3rd with no one saying April Fools. Dylan Mulvaney is the new spokesdylan for Bud Light.

Dylan brought us some Bud Lights so we can watch something called "March Madness." Dylan doesn't know what March Madness is. For you see, Dylan's definition of a girl is someone too vapid and stupid to care about college basketball or even know what is it. Dylan is only into real girl things like fashion and adultery and having a period.

This isn’t a parody. Dylan Mulvaney is now the face of Bud Light. pic.twitter.com/cpygA74cG5
— Ian Miles Cheong (@stillgray) April 2, 2023

To celebrate Dylan being a girl for 365 days, Bud Light even gave Dylan Dylan's own can. Here's what gives me much amusement over this decision. I'm racking my brain, and I can't think of a single girl who has celebrated at least 7,665 days of being a girl who ever got an endorsement deal, their own Bud Light commercial, or their own Bud Light can. Yet Dylan is a girl for a fraction of that and gets accolades. Looks like everything feminists said about the patriarchy is right!

The patriarchy goes man, woman born a man, woman born a man who recognizes how easy it is to become famous on TikTok, biological man who capes for women that were born men, woman. This stands in contrast to the left's pound-for-pound most marginalized rankings where trans is undefeated and undisputed at #1 and every other group battles it out to crack into the top five.

All we can hope at this point is for a whistleblower to leak about the decision-making process. Somewhere in a America, in a conference room, a group of marketing professionals pitched and discussed this idea as a good one. OR, one person made the suggestion, and everyone else was afraid to speak up.

Our DMs are open, whistleblowers. Do it for the content.
